meanings.sent1: She was befooling her friend with a magic trick.
meanings.sent2: The con artist was befooling people with his scams.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous boy enjoyed befooling his classmates with pranks.
meanings.sent4: The illusionist was befooling the audience with his sleight of hand.
meanings.sent5: The cunning fox was befooling the other animals in the forest.

meanings.definition: The act of making someone appear foolish or stupid
meanings.sent1: His befooling of others led to his own embarrassment.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's befooling of the audience brought laughter to the room.
meanings.sent3: The playful befooling of the teacher by the students was all in good fun.
meanings.sent4: The jester's befooling of the king was met with uproarious laughter.
meanings.sent5: The clown's befooling of the circus-goers left them in stitches.
